full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 645 Filed 03/11/22 Page 21 of 50 21 M38TMAX1 given the questionnaire. Q. You say, if you had to estimate, an hour to fill out the questionnaire? A. Maybe. I think that would be accurate. Q. And to return to 48, so you just said it was pretty easy to, if yes, explain, if no, explain, so you skimmed through that. Looking again at 48, which has sort of a lot of white space for the answer there, do you see that? A. Yes, your Honor. Q. And again, this is how many of the questions were structured: Check box yes self, yes friend or family, or no. Tell me again your thought process and how you understood the yes self, and yes friend or family. A. I just read the friend or family, again, like distracted, so I missed that "have you," and then "yes self" while reading this question. Q. At the time you were filling this out, were you surprised the questionnaire asked about friend and family but not about you? A. I didn't honestly think about it. Q. At the time you filled out the questionnaire, did you think that your history of sexual abuse would be something that the parties and I would want to know in order to determine if you could be fair and impartial? A. Looking back thinking now, yes, that's a question that SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00010236
